definition: medical scientist
medical/medicine/doctor/to cure/to treat
to learn/to study/to imitate/science/-ology

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: A forensic scientist there tells Holloway’s father it’s bone from a human female.
sentences.chinese: 那裏的法醫學家告訴哈勒維的父親這個骨頭是女性的。

sentences.english: Jessica, a 42-year-old forensic scientist, is typical of the lucky group.
sentences.chinese: 四十二歲的法醫學家傑西卡是幸運組的典型。

sentences.english: Eating fruit is regarded as the golden rule and precious percept after a meal, but physicians put forward the objection.
sentences.chinese: 飯後一隻果被奉爲金科玉律，但醫學家卻提出了異議。

sentences.english: Li Jianyi was a traditional Chinese physician with great achievements in modern times.
sentences.chinese: 李健頤是近現代醫學史上一位頗有建樹的中醫學家。

sentences.english: A practicing forensic scientist has a built-in bias or predisposition toward the prosecution's side.
sentences.chinese: 開業的法醫學家對辯方有一種固有的偏愛或傾向。

sentences.english: Smallpox inoculation or variolation is a great invention of medicine in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 人痘接種預防天花是中國古代醫學家的偉大發明。

sentences.english: Li Shizhen(1518–1593), was one of the greatest physicians and pharmacologists.
sentences.chinese: 李時珍是最偉大的醫學家和藥理學家之一。

sentences.english: REBT pays more attention to the collaboration between the therapist and patient.
sentences.chinese: REBT更注重臨牀醫學家和病人之間的協作。

sentences.english: Forensic experts will begin to examine victims' remains from today.
sentences.chinese: 法醫學家將從今天開始這項工作。

sentences.english: I had a best friend for a while who was a professional therapist.
sentences.chinese: 我之前有位摯友，她是個專業的臨牀醫學家。

definition: pharmacology
offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood
scholar of the rationalist school of Neo-Confucianism 理學|理学[Li3 xue2]
founding master of a monastery/founder/originator
anecdote/apocryphal story
to spread/to hand down/to disseminate
botanist

the Book of History, one of the Five Classics of Confucianism 五經|五经[Wu3 jing1], a compendium of documents which make up the oldest extant texts of Chinese history, from legendary times down to the time of Confucius, also known as 尚書經|尚书经[Shang4 shu1 jing1], 尚書|尚书[Shang4 shu1], 書|书[Shu1]
Chinese phonetics (concerned also with rhyme in poetry)
divination combined with mystical Confucian philosopy, prevalent during the Eastern Han Dynasty (25-220)
healer/physician/medical man/doctor (esp. of TCM)
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
to write for sb else/a lawyer who writes legal documents for his clients
Laiyang county level city in Yantai 煙台|烟台, Shandong
standing above the common crowd (idiom); outstanding/excellent and unrivaled
Marcus Tullius Cicero (106-43 BC), famous Roman politician, orator and philosopher, murdered at the orders of Marc Anthony
